Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Fluorescence-Guided Surgery and Photoimmunotherapy in Pancreatic Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: Mice were randomised into FGS-only (n=8) and FGS + PIT (n=8) groups

Participants.evidence: 16 nude mice with surgical orthotopic implantation of the human pancreatic cancer cell line BxPC-3

Intervention.evidence: Mice were randomised into FGS-only (n=8) and FGS + PIT (n=8) groups

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the effectiveness of combining fluorescence-guided surgery (FGS) with photoimmunotherapy (PIT)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the rate of metastatic recurrence, assessed four weeks post-surgery

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applied to outcome assessors, patients, or clinicians

Number_Randomised.evidence: Mice were randomised into FGS-only (n=8) and FGS + PIT (n=8) groups

Result_Outcome.evidence: The metastatic recurrence rate was 100% in the FGS-only group and 25% in the FGS + PIT group (p=0.007)

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group
